website_summaries.verdict: The Mizuno Wave Catalyst 2 gained generally positive remarks from runners. They felt that it was a nice update, marked with helpful components and features. They even enjoyed its performance, noting the comfort that they felt during their activities while wearing it. Inversely, there were those who had some gripes with its width and sizing scheme.
pros: Several runners noted that the Mizuno Wave Catalyst 2 was suitably lightweight for their activities
The toe box accommodated natural toe-splay, some consumers wrote
The collar and heel of the upper secured the food well and prevented slipping, a reviewer observed
A tester lauded this shoe for being efficient for mid-distance running sessions
A satisfied purchaser stated that wearing the Catalyst 2 prevented her feet from feeling tired or sore throughout the day
According to a tester, there’s more support in this shoe than a track flat, which made for great extended exercises
cons: The forefoot section of the upper felt a bit narrow, according to some testers
Some users say that the shoe's upper design is a bit outdated for its price tag
The shoe's outsole is not thick enough, as noted by some wearers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support for those of us with flat feet.
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and my knee was hurting for a few months while running. My runs would usually end in pain after 2-3 miles. I had no idea it was my 7 month old shoes until I put this pair on. I had no more pain and could resume my usual 5-10 mile runs. I guess they offer the proper support in the right part of my foot. They're that good! I'm not too crazy how they look but running without pain is more important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I just got these yesterday and ran in them this morning (4 miles with HIIT intervals). I have to say - these are really good. I got them as an alternative to my usual running shoes and am glad I did. If you're flat footed and need something with a little more structural support, I have no problem recommending these. Not to mention the price is great versus similar offerings from the big name brands.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kipp

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe to address over pronation
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear New Balance but I have an issue with over pronation. The Mizuno Running Shoes seem to feel the best and are a great value. I average 20,000 steps per day so I go through a lot of running shoes.. . the Mizuno also seem to wear well and last a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: r.drew

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: So far this feels like a really good shoe. Currently, I have the Inspire and the Hitogami, and the Catalyst has a comfortable feel between the two. I haven't got much running in yet, but the Catalyst promises to better than either of the other two.
customer_reviews.author: Thumper

customer_reviews.title: Slow to break in
customer_reviews.text: Super good for sprints. Nice stability. Only bad I could think of is at the beginning they're too fitted, to the point of making my feet numb even though I made sure laces were loose enough. With normal use they've become better. NOTE please I have narrow feet. Not too narrow or bony like to buy a narrow size but that's my point, these are for the average feet and run kinda narrow/tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for flat feet!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and decided to give it a try. These shoes felt amazing from the first minute I put them on. My workouts felt so much better. I honestly didn't mind the color combination. It gave me a break from the other bland color mixes. This is all about comfort though.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Great for flat feet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my husband who has flat feet and he's on them a lot for work. He goes through shoes like crazy! After doing some research, these were recommended for people with flat feet, so I thought I'd get them. Glad I did.....husband loves them and the color!
customer_reviews.author: Metalbrat72

customer_reviews.title: Good fiting, very comfy shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review after using this shoe for about a year. It fit as expected, very comfy. Only negative thing, is that the inside lining of the back heel started to tear after about a year. Other mizuno shoes i had lasted about 2 years before the inside lining of the heel started to tear. But still, a good shoe, and i actually ordered another one just recently (on sale).
customer_reviews.author: E.I

customer_reviews.title: Running with Happy Feet
customer_reviews.text: I have a slightly wider than normal foot, so I sometimes have issues with the stitching and seams in running shoes. When I first tried this shoe on, I was concerned with a few spots on the outside of the shoe, but after running 100+ miles in these shoes I have not had any issues. I was a huge fan of the Wave Elixir and the subsequent Wave Sayonara and I found this shoe to be a suitable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few days to break in, but when they do it's on like Donkey Kong.
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes. Light and great stylin' design. Took a few days to break in with 5 mile jobs each trip. They breath well, and fit like a glove. Found my daily runners until these die on me.
customer_reviews.author: J Tee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a fan and user of ASICS when it comes to running sneakers. The only other running sneaker I use and trust are Mizuno. This is my 3rd pair of Mizuno sneakers Just like Asics, they fit perfect right out of the box and feel great. From the box to my feet and I wore them for a good portion of the day and no pain, no sneaker break in foot aches. They cradle the foot and support the arch just right. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Marie Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I have a very low arch and these shoes worked ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a very low arch and these shoes worked perfectly for me. I got at least 300 miles out of them before I noticed they were starting to wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable on my wide feet
customer_reviews.text: As a woman with a very wide foot, I can only wear a man's wide shoe. These do the job beautifully. This is the 4th pair of Mizuno's I've had.
customer_reviews.author: MScha

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: Although didn’t get this pair for running, (got Mizuno Emperor for that), I like the weight and style of this Catalyst for my day-in-and-out all purpose walking. It’s lighter than the Rider and feels quite comfortable for a 10K+ steps day. After a couple of more months, I shall then decide to retire my all faithful near 10 years old Alchemy, and get another pair of Catalyst.
customer_reviews.author: Trying to be fair and productive.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good shoes. It does not have quite the cushioning I would have hoped for. I knew it would be not be very cushioned when I bought it, but it's even less than I expected, but otherwise fits well and provides good support.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Not the best Mizuno running shoes
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes is not as light weighted as other mizuno running shoes. It's probably not good for race shoes, but they work just fine for jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Killing my back.
customer_reviews.text: First shoe I've bought online from Amazon that is just killing my back. Don't know why, really like Mizuno's usually. But evidently the support is non-existent. And no recourse because I wore them.
customer_reviews.author: Elgorto22

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and feels great
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfortable to walk or run 🏃🏼‍♀️ in. First time I liked a shoe for running outside of ASICS. I hope this model isn’t going away. Price is very reasonable compared to shoes that cost 150 to 200 dollars. I’ll never pay that much for shoes. Overall great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: jack schroyer

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoe for medium stability.
customer_reviews.text: This model has less stability and support for pronation than some of their other models, but still a very nice ride down the street.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Brooks Adrenaline GTS gave me a good 200 miles of arch support
customer_reviews.text: Not enough arch support. My Brooks Adrenaline GTS gave me a good 200 miles of arch support. But rather than return this shoe, it should be good enough for a walking in/around town shoe. I will prob try out the Brooks Beast shoe to see if I can get more than 200 miles of arch support.
customer_reviews.author: larkinrd

customer_reviews.title: Mizuno or Just No
customer_reviews.text: I always buy 1/2 size bigger for running (always have) not that they run small. Have been in Mizunos for 9 years since I started running and have tried others, always coming back!
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Vail

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't expect less from this specialized running brand. The difference is notorious, the quality is exceptional and the comfort is outstanding. Overall a Great pair of running shoes
customer_reviews.author: JULY

customer_reviews.title: I loved this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I loved this shoe. Unfortunately for me the toe box was tight and the shoe did not have enough depth for me. I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Muzikontime

customer_reviews.title: Super Narrow!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could return these. We purchased the recommended size, but these shoes hurt and are very narrow fitting!
customer_reviews.author: MarsArmy1977_Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Still early, but so far they seem to be comfortable and fit as needed. Will have to see how well they last. I am pretty hard on footware.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe so far. I've found Mizunos to be durable. My favorite Mizunos were too expensive this time around, so I went with this Wave Catalyst 2. It's good, but I still prefer the Prophecy or the Creation, but they were out of my price range.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kolokowsky

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight summer training
customer_reviews.text: So far great. Lightweight. Stable. Good push off in the toe box. Will see how it lasts
customer_reviews.author: Elli t

customer_reviews.title: Not so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very stiff. I am disappointed especially since I having been buying other Mizuno styles.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Houle

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way they filled, always loved the Mizuno shoes and never let down, recommend it buy you size.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this shoe choice
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and light weight. Very happy with the shoe for blend of jogging and walking on street and groomed trails.
customer_reviews.author: JandB

customer_reviews.title: Good for distance running
customer_reviews.text: Logged about thirty miles after a few weeks. They are great. Good for flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tyler

customer_reviews.title: The Best I have walked in.
customer_reviews.text: I walk daily about 5 miles. the Catalyst 2 are everything that could be expected. Have couple other models of Muzuno's these are the lightest. Shoe fits like a glove. and will differently buy another pair. Hope nothing gets changed
customer_reviews.author: Larry from Az

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes are somewhat small, and the sole is very rigid.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorio Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not a good fit. Not able to run in these as intended. A total waste of$$!
customer_reviews.author: Goodie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good; just used them today. Very comfortable for my flat, wide feet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The logo on the shoes is sown on in a way that scratches your foot
customer_reviews.author: Athelete

customer_reviews.title: No more ankle pain
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of the same shoe i've purchase. This new Model is so amazing. I've had ankle pain for the last couple of years and since I've started running in these ones its completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned previous Mizuno’s before, specifically the previous model of this shoe, and I am pleased with the performance. I’ve been using them for years and even during some road races.
customer_reviews.author: S D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great to run
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. Great to run. How can I go running without Mizuno?
customer_reviews.author: BUYBUYBUY

customer_reviews.title: He said the fit was perfect but the shoe laces were short
customer_reviews.text: These were for my husband. He said the fit was perfect but the shoe laces were short.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Untrauer

customer_reviews.title: Runs narrow
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand, but the shoe runs narrow. Cannot wear for long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Taffysez

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe hard sole
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes but not overly flexible due to the hard plastic sole.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Solid daily running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Over 200 miles in and no problems. No break in needed, never got a blister, and they look like the day I bought them. I have been running on the Sayanora and Catalyst series for the last 2 years and Wave Inspire before that.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart quicker than usual.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe wound up having chunks of missing material on the inside. Mizuno is my go-to shoe, but I would not recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: j.Schoeller

customer_reviews.title: Mizuno Comes Through - Again
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Mizuno's for 15 years. I tried switching about 5 years ago to New Balance - no-go. If it's not broken, don't fix it, right?!
customer_reviews.author: Neil McGuffog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: they will stretch some when you get them broke in.
customer_reviews.author: e.s.

customer_reviews.title: Overall the shoe was a great purchase($60 for them was amazing)
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly stable shoe, I put in about 200 miles on them, and they are still going strong. The four star rating is because the shoe is a lot more narrow than other shoes. Overall the shoe was a great purchase($60 for them was amazing).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right amount of support
customer_reviews.text: One of the few shoes out there with good support without all the bulk and weight. Works well with my Superfeet Blue insert.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several pairs of Mazunos and very satisfied with the fit and comfort
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Nilsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you are in to foot binding..
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looked cool but, they were too narrow with very short laces to tie. It came with 45" laces and I had to buy 54" laces from the local sporting goods store.
customer_reviews.author: Hatchez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Favorite brand. Was replacing worn out ones with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Catalyst 2.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent I love, very beautiful, meets all expectations the product. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: César García García

customer_reviews.title: and these shoes provide the support he needs while being extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My son runs cross country, and these shoes provide the support he needs while being extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Julie H. Dent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. My last pair lasted way longer than I expected. I hope they keep making this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: steven buchan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value / great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value if you're looking for a cheaper option than the Wave Rider. Not quite as much cushioning, but fits almost identically. Great for speed work, and short to mid-range distances.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: ... owned the Wave Inspire and the Wave Rider (and liked both), as well as shoes from other brands
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Wave Inspire and the Wave Rider (and liked both), as well as shoes from other brands, but these are hands down the best running shoes I have ever owned. Great cushioning, great responsiveness, and lightweight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, not much cushion as Asics gt 2000 but lighter weight. Great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Helped feel less pain with my flat feet. Just need a wider toe box. Going up in size to see.
customer_reviews.author: Arsenio Wright

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A comfortable running shoe that is especially good for race day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my feet
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno's footwear fit my feet very well. I have worn their trail running shoes in the past. This is my first pair of their road runners. Although I haven't used them significantly, they fit like a glove, are comfortable and light. The cushioning is sufficient without being bulky or excessive. I look forward to many miles in them
customer_reviews.author: treadmark

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes, very comfortable for my feet and joints.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Miley

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I had read somewhere on the internet that the wave catalyst 2 would weigh considerably more than the original wave catalyst, which disappointed me greatly. However, once I received the catalyst 2 in the mail and placed it on, I knew it wouldn't matter. Somehow this shoe manages to maintain the same level of support as the orig. catalyst while feeling more nimble and quick. The increase in foot strike and turnover experienced during the ride has been incredible. Thanks mizuno for improving this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Miles M

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for avid runner.
customer_reviews.text: Husband got his foot sized and looked at in the Mizuno store in Atlanta. They recommended these shoes for him so we knew they were going to be perfect. They were $109 in store and $48 on Amazon. He highly recommends them.
customer_reviews.author: Beanz

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Training Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Mizuno running shoes. I've had them 3 days and have trained in them both inside and outside close to 5 hours already. Super comfortable right out of the box, no breaking in period at all. Fit perfectly. Much lighter than my last 2 pair of Mizunos, So far, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ann Mastin

customer_reviews.title: Goo running sneaker...
customer_reviews.text: These running shoes are well made and fit as expected. Designed is as described by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are superb!
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Mizuno running shoes and these are no exception. I love how they fit and they are super comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Saxman1005

customer_reviews.title: ... day of use and my husband says they are fine!!
customer_reviews.text: this is the first day of use and my husband says they are fine!!
customer_reviews.author: Margie Spiess

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gone for a run in them yet and they are breaking in nicely
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Cote-Burk

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits narrow in the toe box. Compared to Wave Rider and Inspire, this is definitely narrower.
customer_reviews.author: Arwin Ton

customer_reviews.title: com/dp/B01GXPV6VC/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_5 and much happier with those
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why but they gave me foot pain in the center of my arch. Switched to  and much happier with those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Catalyst 2
product_meta.description: Wave Catalyst 2 is the running shoe designed for durability and guidance. A midsole reacts to your movements so you can move with ease and durable lightweight fabric can withstand heavy footfalls that come with a rigorous run.
feature_bullets: Improved DynamotionFit that moves with the foot for a secure, flexible fit
Fan Wave for structural guidance and shock absorption
New forefoot mesh adds depth and functionality
Top midsole incorporates new U4ic compound (more responsive and durable)
